title: Biden honors Monterey Park shooting victims, takes executive actions on guns
description: Biden also acknowledged the heroism of Brandon Tsay, who subdued the gunman to bring an end to the attack and who attended his State of the Union Address in February.

title: Silicon Valley Bank: How a digital bank run accelerated the collapse
description: The second-biggest bank failure in U.S. history took less than 48 hours.

title: Will Silicon Valley Bank's collapse impact the climate tech industry?
description: Silicon Valley Bank marketed itself as a climate tech-friendly bank. How will its collapse impact the industry?

title: Assisted living facility faces felony charges over deadly COVID-19 outbreak
description: Los Angeles prosecutors announced felony charges in connection with a deadly COVID-19 outbreak at an upscale assisted living facility that started in March 2020.

title: 14-year sentence for ex-cop who molested teen rape victim
description: A former New Orleans police officer has been sentenced to 14 years in federal prison for sexually assaulting a 15-year-old girl who was already a rape victim

title: Judge: Netflix's 'Making a Murderer' didn't defame detective
description: A retired Wisconsin detective has lost a defamation lawsuit against streaming giant Netflix over his portrayal in the 2015 documentary series “Making a Murderer.”

title: More than 60 Omega-3 dog and cat supplements recalled
description: The FDA released a recall of 62 brands of Omega-3 supplements for cats and dogs made by Stratford Care USA, Inc.

title: EPA announces limits on some 'forever chemicals,' but just a fraction are covered
description: The EPA announced its first-ever rule to reduce the amount of PFAS chemicals also known as "forever chemicals" in drinking water on Tuesday.

title: Russian fighters collide with US drone, force it down close to Ukraine
description: Russian fighter forces down U.S. drone close to Ukraine over Black Sea, U.S. calls incident "dangerous" and warns could lead to "unintended escalation"

title: Justice Department, SEC probing collapse of Silicon Valley Bank: Sources
description: The Justice Department and Securities and Exchange Commission are probing the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank, according to two people familiar with the situation.

title: No Harvey Weinstein retrial on rape, sex assault charges
description: Los Angeles prosecutors say they will not retry Harvey Weinstein on rape and sexual assault charges involving two women

title: Biden lets it slip that Jimmy Carter wants him to deliver Carter's eulogy
description: Joe Biden let it slip Monday at a fundraiser that Jimmy Carter asked him to deliver Carter's eulogy, according to a pool reporter there

title: Sanders signs Arkansas trans care malpractice bill into law
description: Arkansas Gov. Sarah Huckabee Sanders has signed a law that could effectively reinstate the state's blocked ban on gender-affirming care for children

title: 2 'The Voice of Holland' ex-stars face sex offense charges
description: Prosecutors say that two former stars of “The Voice of Holland” will be charged with sex offenses linked to the once-popular Dutch talent show

title: Tyson to close poultry facilities in Virginia, Arkansas
description: Tyson Foods is closing two facilities that employ more than 1,600 people in an effort to streamline its U.S. poultry business

title: Nor'easter has already dumped more than a foot of snow in multiple regions
description: More than a foot of snow has already fallen in several regions along the East Coast as a nor'easter bears down on the region.

title: Romanian court rejects bail request by divisive Andrew Tate
description: An official says a Romanian court has rejected a bail request from the divisive social media influencer and former professional kickboxer Andrew Tate, who is detained in the country on suspicion of organized crime and human trafficking

title: Biden to deliver former President Jimmy Carter's eulogy
description: President Joe Biden says he plans to deliver the eulogy at the funeral of former President Jimmy Carter, who remains under hospice care at his home in south Georgia

title: Ohio Supreme Court to review block of near-ban on abortion
description: The Ohio Supreme Court has agreed to review a judge’s order that is blocking enforcement of Ohio's so-called heartbeat abortion ban, and to consider whether the clinics that have sued have standing to challenge the law

title: Class action suit filed against Silicon Valley Bank parent
description: The suit says the company didn’t disclose risks of future interest rate hikes.

title: San Francisco to air Black reparations plan, $5M per person
description: San Francisco supervisors are taking up a draft reparations proposal that includes a $5 million lump-sum payment for each eligible Black person

title: Conn. woman 1st non-Vermonter granted assisted suicide right
description: Vermont has agreed to a legal settlement that will allow a Connecticut woman to be the first out-of-stater to take advantage of its decade-old law that allows people who are terminally ill to end their own lives

title: Facebook parent Meta slashes another 10,000 jobs
description: "This will be tough and there's no way around that," said CEO Mark Zuckerberg.

title: Novo Nordisk plans price cuts for several insulins
description: Novo Nordisk will start slashing some U.S. insulin prices up to 75% next year.

title: US inflation eases but stays high, putting Fed in tough spot
description: U.S. consumer price increases eased slightly from January to February but still pointed to an elevated inflation rate that is posing a challenge for the Federal Reserve at a delicate moment for the financial system

title: WATCH:  Indonesian volcano erupts
description: Ash and lava spew from Indonesia's Mount Merapi, the country's most active volcano.

title: Ex-sheriff convicted of civil rights abuses to be sentenced
description: A former Georgia sheriff convicted of violating the civil rights of people in his custody by unnecessarily strapping them into restraint chairs is set to be sentenced

title: Russian missile hits another Ukraine apartment block, 1 dead
description: A Russian missile has struck an apartment building in the center of the Ukrainian city of Kramatorsk

title: Asian shares fall, European markets mixed amid bank worries
description: European markets are mixed after a broad retreat in Asia as investors watch to see what's next following the second- and third-largest bank failures in U.S. history

title: Biden expected to sign new executive order on gun control
description: President Joe Biden is expected to sign an executive order aiming to increase the number of background checks to buy guns

title: China says AUKUS on 'dangerous path' with nuclear subs deal
description: China says the United States, Australia and the United Kingdom are traveling “further down the wrong and dangerous path for their own geopolitical self-interest.”

title: Former Rep. Pat Schroeder, pioneer for women's rights, dies
description: A pioneer for women’s and family rights in Congress, former Colorado Rep. Pat Schroeder, has died at the age of 82

title: WATCH:  Chicago River dyed bright green for St. Patrick's Day
description: St. Patrick’s Day celebrations are well underway in the Windy City as the Chicago River is dyed emerald green -- a tradition that dates back to 1962.

title: WATCH:  Giant gator bends metal fence while forcing its way through
description: A large alligator got stuck between metal fence posts after trying to force its way to the other side.

title: Seoul: North Korea launches 2 ballistic missiles toward sea
description: South Korea says North Korea has launched two ballistic missiles toward its eastern waters in its second show of force this week

title: Oversight Committee probes Hunter Biden, Raskin accuses chair of blocking Trump probe
description: The new House Oversight chair has issued a subpoena to Bank of America for records related to associates of Hunter Biden, according to committee member Jamie Raskin.

title: 2 dead, several injured after driver hits pedestrians in Quebec
description: Two people are dead and several are injured after a driver hit pedestrians in Amqui, a town in the Québec region of Canada, authorities told ABC News.
